1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: wn_print.c Sun 11-19-2000 10:49:43 pm HvA V1.00 $
3    | ***************************************************************************/
4    | 
5    | #include <stdarg.h>
6    | #include <string.h>
7    | #include "video\v_video.h"
8    | #include "window.h"
9    | 
10   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
11   |    FUNCTION: wn_printf()
12   |     PURPOSE: printf function for windows
13   |      SYNTAX: int wn_printf(WINDOW *w, char *format, ...);
14   | DESCRIPTION: -
15   |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW: window not opened
16   |              TRUE     : all ok
17   |     HISTORY: 910708 V0.1 - Initial version
18   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
19   | int wn_printf(WINDOWPTR w, char *format, ...)
20   | {
21   |   va_list arguments;
22   |   int i;
23   |   int row,col;
24   |   int len;
25   |   char s[132];
26   | 
27   |   /*------------------------
28   |     Check if window opened
29   |   --------------------------*/
30   |   if (!w)
31   |     return(NO_WINDOW);
32   | 
33   |   /*----------------------------
34   |     Make this the active window
35   |   ------------------------------*/
36   |   if (w != top_window)
37   |     wn_top(w);
38   | 
39   |   /*-------------
40   |     Build string
41   |   ---------------*/
42   |   va_start(arguments,format);
43   |   vsprintf(s,format,arguments);
44   |   va_end(arguments);
45   | 
46   |   /*------------------------------------------
47   |     Print string in window with own routines
48   |   -------------------------------------------*/
49   |   i = 0;                      /* Reset counter */
50   |   col = w->ccx;               /* Get window cursor coordinates   */
51   |   row = w->ccy;
52   | 
53   |   len = strlen(s);
54   |   wn_log("(%02d,%02d)/%-d wn_printf(%p,%s,'%s')\n",row,col,len,w,w->title,s);
55   |   if (s[len-1] != '\n') wn_log("\n");
56   | 
57   |   while (s[i])
58   |   {
59   |     switch (s[i])
60   |     {
61   |       case 0x0A:     /* LF */
62   |         col = w->x1;
63   |         row++;
64   |         break;
65   | 
66   |       case 0x0D:     /* CR */
67   |         col = w->x1;
68   |         break;
69   | 
70   |       case 0x09:     /* HT */
71   |         col += 4;
72   |         break;
73   | 
74   |       case 0x0B:     /* VT */
75   |         row++;
76   |         break;
77   | 
78   |       case 0x0C:     /* FF */
79   |         row++;
80   |         col = w->x1;
81   |         break;
82   | 
83   |       case 0x08:     /* BS */
84   |         if (col <= w->x1)
85   |           col = w->x1;
86   |         else
87   |           col--;
88   |         v_setcurpos(row,col);
89   |         v_printc(row,col,' ');
90   |         break;
91   | 
92   |       default:
93   |         v_printc(row,col,s[i]);
94   |         col++;
95   |     }
96   | 
97   |     /*----------------------------------------------
98   |       Test position of cursor row and column, and
99   |       adjust these if neccessary
100  |     -----------------------------------------------*/
101  |     if (col > w->x2) {
102  |       col = w->x1;
103  |       row++;
104  |     }
105  |     if (row > w->y2) {
106  |       wn_scroll(w,1);
107  |       col = w->x1;
108  |       row = w->y2;
109  |     }
110  | 
111  |     i++;        /* point to next character */
112  | 
113  |   }
114  | 
115  | 
116  |   /*------------------------------------------------
117  |     Update cursor position in window control block
118  |     and on screen
119  |   -------------------------------------------------*/
120  |   w->ccx = col;
121  |   w->ccy = row;
122  |   v_setcurpos(row,col);
123  | 
124  |   return(TRUE);
125  | }
